About Us:

TreeHouse Foods (NYSE: THS) is a leading manufacturer of private label packaged foods and beverages, operating a network of production facilities across the United States and Canada. At TreeHouse Foods, our commitment to excellence extends beyond our products and revolves around our people. We are investing in talent and creating a performance-based culture where employees can do their best work, directly impacting our mission to make high quality, affordable food for our customers, communities and families. We hope you will consider joining the team and being part of our future.

What You Gain:

Competitive compensation and benefits programEnrollment in our wellness and employee assistance programsPaid holidays, vacation, and other competitive paid time off opportunitiesAn inclusive working environment where you can build meaningful work relationships with a diverse group of people Leaders who are invested in supporting your career growthOpportunities to be recognized for outstanding contributions to your team through our employee recognition programs

Job Description:

Job Description: 

This position could include 1st, 2nd, or 3rd shift. Experience in manufacturing utilities (boilers, wastewater treatment, cooling systems) a plus.

The essential functions for the Maintenance position are listed below. This description of the essential job functions excludes any marginal functions that are incidental to the performance of fundamental job duties.

This description in no way states or implies that those job functions listed below are the only job duties to be performed by the employee(s) occupying the Maintenance position. Employees will be required to follow any other job related duties requested by their Supervisor.

The essential job functions listed below are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills and/or abilities. To perform jobs successfully, the incumbent will be required to perform the essential functions with or without accommodation. In the event of absence, the position will be covered from a pool of trained, qualified backups.

Bay Valley Foods reserves the right to modify, delete or add to the essential functions for the Maintenance position at any time.

Roles & Responsibilities: 

Will read, write, speak and communicate efficiently in English with a wide variety of people and personalities.Will perform basic mathematical functions.Will keep legible and accurate records.Will read follow verbal and written instructions and company-posted work and safety policies, procedures and programs.Will follow all safety rules and regulations, perform all duties in a safe and efficient manner, and wear all required personal protective equipment, including but not limited to steel-toe safety shoes and hearing protection in designated areas.Will conform to all good manufacturing practices and be responsible for the cleanliness of immediate work area and contribute to the overall cleanliness of the facility.Will have adequate vision ability (depth perception and field of vision) to move around the facility safely and distinguish colors.Will have a good sense of smell.Will work in all areas of the facility, both inside and outside, and on all floors in the facility.Will work any shift, overtime, holidays and weekends as production requires based on seniority.Will possess and maintain a valid forklift operator’s license at all times and operate the forklift in a safe and efficient manner.During periods of downtime, will consult with supervisor for assignment of job duties to be performed.Will communicate concerns/issues/problems to supervisor/co-workers in a timely and professional manner.Responsible for recognizing and reporting food safety and/or quality issues to supervisor and/or manager.Will have the knowledge and ability to install, set-up, maintain, troubleshoot and repair all equipment in the facility.Will have the knowledge and ability to follow and work from blueprints, sketches, verbal instructions and/or written work orders with minimal supervision.Will have the ability and working knowledge of machine repair, welding, machine shop equipment, electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic and pumps.Will understand, sign and conform to written power lockout procedures.Will perform duties efficiently and calmly during critical “down time” situations.Will be willing and able to attend training classes or seminars that may require out of town and/or over night travel.Will possess and maintain a good attendance and work record.Will train employees coming into the classification of all duties that are required of this position.Will assist and/or train with others when needed and perform other duties as assigned.Must have the ability to operate proficiently in an SAP environment; including but not limited to using an RF (radio frequency) device, print and place tags, and able to effectively use a scanner and related portable equipment.Responsible for complying with all Food Quality, Food Safety/SQF, and GMP policies and procedures.

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities (List all required):

Will walk/stand for the duration of a 8-hour shift and be able to use both hands, twist, bend, stoop, reach and maneuver in tight or cramped areas.Will climb stairs, ladders, equipment scaffolding, tanks and heights to 50 feet.Will push/pull objects weighing up to 550 pounds to chest level up to 100 times per normal 8- hour shift with the assistance of material handling equipment.Will lift objects weighing up to 100 pounds from waist-level to chest-level up to 10 times per normal 8-hour shift with the assistance of a lift and/or co-worker.Will use one or both hands to hold, grip, and use tools required for duties, including but not limited to a utility knife.Will hear and talk on an ongoing basis in an atmosphere of moderate and loud noise.Will work in and around cold water or hot water up to 185° F.Will work in cold, warm, hot, humid and/or wet conditions.

Education:

 High School or equivalent

output_json.title: Maintenance Technician-2
job_responsibilities: Reads, writes, speaks, and communicates efficiently in English.
Performs basic mathematical functions.
Keeps legible and accurate records.
Reads and follows verbal and written instructions and company-posted work and safety policies, procedures, and programs.
Follows all safety rules and regulations, performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner, and wears all required personal protective equipment.
Conforms to all good manufacturing practices and is responsible for the cleanliness of the immediate work area and contributes to the overall cleanliness of the facility.
Has adequate vision ability (depth perception and field of vision) to move around the facility safely and distinguishes colors.
Has a good sense of smell.
Works in all areas of the facility, both inside and outside, and on all floors in the facility.
Works any shift, overtime, holidays, and weekends as production requires based on seniority.
Possesses and maintains a valid forklift operator’s license at all times and operates the forklift in a safe and efficient manner.
Consults with supervisor for assignment of job duties during periods of downtime.
Communicates concerns/issues/problems to supervisor/co-workers in a timely and professional manner.
Responsible for recognizing and reporting food safety and/or quality issues to supervisor and/or manager.
Has the knowledge and ability to install, set-up, maintain, troubleshoot, and repair all equipment in the facility.
Has the knowledge and ability to follow and work from blueprints, sketches, verbal instructions, and/or written work orders with minimal supervision.
Has the ability and working knowledge of machine repair, welding, machine shop equipment, electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic, and pumps.
Understands, signs, and conforms to written power lockout procedures.
Performs duties efficiently and calmly during critical “down time” situations.
Is willing and able to attend training classes or seminars that may require out-of-town and/or overnight travel.
Possesses and maintains a good attendance and work record.
Trains employees coming into the classification of all duties that are required of this position.
Assists and/or trains with others when needed and performs other duties as assigned.

Must have the ability to operate proficiently in an SAP environment; including but not limited to using an RF (radio frequency) device, print and place tags, and able to effectively use a scanner and related portable equipment.
Responsible for complying with all Food Quality, Food Safety/SQF, and GMP policies and procedures.
physical_requirements: Walks/stands for the duration of an 8-hour shift and is able to use both hands, twist, bend, stoop, reach, and maneuver in tight or cramped areas.
Climbs stairs, ladders, equipment scaffolding, tanks, and heights to 50 feet.
Pushes/pulls objects weighing up to 550 pounds to chest level up to 100 times per normal 8-hour shift with the assistance of material handling equipment.
Lifts objects weighing up to 100 pounds from waist-level to chest-level up to 10 times per normal 8-hour shift with the assistance of a lift and/or co-worker.
Uses one or both hands to hold, grip, and use tools required for duties.
Hears and talks on an ongoing basis in an atmosphere of moderate and loud noise.
Works in and around cold water or hot water up to 185°F.
Works in cold, warm, hot, humid, and/or wet conditions.
benefits: Enrollment in wellness and employee assistance programs
Paid holidays, vacation, and other competitive paid time off opportunities
An inclusive working environment where you can build meaningful work relationships with a diverse group of people
Leaders who are invested in supporting your career growth
Opportunities to be recognized for outstanding contributions to your team through employee recognition programs
